juzs.text: Those who do not expect that they are destined to meet Us say, "Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly become too proud of themselves and excessively insolent
On the day they see the angels, there won't be any good news for those who denied God, and [the angels guarding the gate to paradise] will say, "Stop, stay out
We will examine their deeds and scatter them like dust
Meanwhile those who are destined for paradise will, on that Day, be securely settled in the best resting place
The Day when heaven will split open with clouds [emerging], and the angels are sent down successively in streams
True sovereignty, on that Day, will belong to the Merciful-to-all. For unbelievers, it will be a day of distress
on that Day the one who was unjust to himself will bite his hands [in regret] and will say, "How I wish I had followed the way of the Messenger
Woe to me! I wish I had not taken so and so as a friend
He led me away from the remembrance [of God] after it had come to me. Satan, has always let man down
The Messenger will say, "My Lord, This Qur'an was abandoned by my people
and thus have We assigned to every prophet an enemy; those, who force others to reject Our messages. But your Lord is sufficient as a guide and a helper
And the unbelievers say, "Why was the Qur'an not sent to him in one single revelation?" [It was revealed in stages] so that We may strengthen your heart. And We revealed it in well-organized portions
And every time they come to you with an argument, We will give you the [full] Truth and the best explanation
As for those who are dragged facedown to Hell, they will be in the worst place as they are the most misguided from the path
And We gave Moses the Book and appointed his brother Aaron to help him
We said, "Go together to the people who have rejected Our signs." Then We destroyed them completely
And the people of Noah-when they denied the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them a sign for people to come. And We have prepared a painful punishment for the unjust
[And the people of] Aad and Thamud, the people of the Al Rass and many generations in between
in each case, We, [warn them with] examples, and each We utterly destroyed
They must surely have come upon the town that was showered with a horrible rain; have they not seen it? But they do not expect resurrection
And whenever they see you [Prophet] they ridicule you, [saying], "Is this the one God sent as a messenger
He would almost have misled us from our gods had we not stood firmly by them." But soon, when they see the punishment, they will know who is the most misguided
Have you seen the one who has taken his own whims as his god? Are you responsible for him
And do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are just like cattle; indeed, they are [even] more lost
Have you not considered how your Lord lengthens the shadow [when], had He so willed, He could have made it stationary? [Instead], We have made the sun its guide
and We draw it back toward us gradually
It is He who made the night a veil for you and sleep for rest, and the day a time for rising
And it is He who sends forth the winds, bringing good news of His mercy. And We send down from the sky pure water
so that We may bring dead land to life and provide drink for the multitude of beings, animals and people, We have created
Indeed, We have distributed it among them so that they might take heed, but most people continue in their denial of the truth
And if We had willed, We could have sent a warner to every town
so do not go along with the unbelievers, but strove hard against them with this [Qur'an]
He is the one who has merged the two seas, one fresh and sweet, the other salty and bitter, and He placed between them an insurmountable barrier
He created human beings from water and made them kin by blood and marriage. Your Lord is able to do all things
Yet, instead of God, they worship what can neither benefit nor harm them. The unbeliever is always biased, against his Lord
We have sent you [Prophet] only to bring good news and deliver a warning
Say, "I ask you no payment for doing this- only that whoever wills may take a path to his Lord
Put your trust in the Everlasting who does not die, glorify Him and celebrate His praise. For it is sufficient that none knows His worshipers' sins as fully as does He

Who created the heavens and the earth and everything in between them in six days, and then established Himself above the Throne of His majesty- the Merciful-to-all! Ask about Him, then, the well informed

Yet, when they are told, "Prostrate yourselves before the Merciful-to-all," they say, "And who is the 'Merciful-to-all'? Should we prostrate ourselves before whatever you order us [to worship]?" And they turn farther away
Blessed is He who has placed constellations in the sky, a radiant light and glowing moon
And It is He who has made night and day succeed each other, [revealing Himself to] for anyone who wishes to be mindful or show gratitude
The worshipers of the Merciful-to-all are those who walk upon the earth with humility, and when the ignorant address them, reply with "peace
those who spend the night prostrating themselves and standing before their Lord
and those who say "Our Lord, spare us the punishment of Hell. Its punishment is dreadful
It is an evil abode and resting-place
They are those who, when they spend, are neither wasteful nor tightfisted, but maintain balanced spending habits

[as well as] those who never invoke another god alongside God nor kill the soul that God has forbidden [to be killed], except in the pursuit of justice, nor commit unlawful sexual intercourse. Whoever does these things will face a penalty
that will be multiplied for him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will remain in humiliation forever
except those who repent, believe and do righteous work, [in that case] God will replace their evil deeds with good ones for God is ever-forgiving and Merciful-to-all
Whoever repents and acts righteously has truly returned to God in repentance
Those who do not testify to falsehood, and, when they pass near ill speech, pass by with dignity
and those who, when reminded of their Lord's revelations, do not turn a deaf ear or a blind eye
and those who say, "Our Lord, give us joy in our spouses and offspring, and make us a good example for those who are ever mindful of You
All of them will be awarded the highest paradise for what they patiently endured and they will be received with greetings of peace
and will live there for eternity. What an excellent home and place of rest
Say [to unbelievers], "What would my Lord care for you if not for your prayers to Him?" But since you have denied the truth as lies, [punishment] will inevitably befall you
Ta Seen Meem
these are the verses of the Book that makes everything clear
Perhaps, [Prophet] you punish yourself with grief because they will not believe
If We so will, We can send down from heaven a miracle that will force their necks to remain bowed in humility
Whenever a new revelation comes to them from the Merciful-to-all, they turn away
They have already denied the truth, but the news of what they used to ridicule will come back to [hunt] them
Do not they see the earth, and how many kinds of noble pairs of plants, We have caused to grow in it
There is a sign in this, but most of them will not believe
Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all
When your Lord called on Moses, [saying], "Go to the unjust people
the people of Pharaoh. Will they not be mindful of Me
He said, "My Lord, I fear that they will call me a liar
and that my breast will tighten, and my tongue will be tied, so send for Aaron
Besides, they have a charge against me, so I fear that they will kill me
[God] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; We are with you, listening
Go to Pharaoh and say, "We are messengers from the Lord of the worlds
let the Children of Israel go with us
[Pharaoh] said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and did you not live among us for many years
[Then] you committed that crime of yours, you were so ungrateful
[Moses] said, "At the time I did it, I was of the misguided
So I fled from you because I feared you. Then my Lord gave me wisdom and made me one of the Messengers
As for that favor of which you remind me, was it not because you enslaved the Children of Israel
Pharaoh said, "But what is the Lord of the worlds
He said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, if you only knew
[Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you hear [what he said]
[Moses went on], "Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers
[Pharaoh] said, "This messenger who has been sent to you is really mad
[Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you [would just use your] reason
[Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely imprison you
[Moses] said, "Even if I show you undeniable proof
[Pharaoh] said, "Bring it, then, if you are telling the truth
So [Moses] threw down his staff; and behold, it was an undeniable snake
Then he drew out his hand, and-behold- it was [shining] white for all to see
[Pharaoh] said to the notables around him, "This is a skilled magician
He wants to drive you out of your land with his magic, so what do you recommend
They said, "Let him and his brother wait for a while, and [meanwhile] send marshals to all the cities
to bring every skilled magician
So the magicians were assembled at the appointed time on the appointed day
It was said to the People, "Have you assembled
so that we might follow the magicians if they win
When the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there a reward for us if we win
He said, "Yes. You will be in my inner circle
Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you will throw
So they threw their ropes and their staffs, and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, We will surely win
Then Moses threw down his staff, and it devoured their deceptions
And down fell the magicians in prostration [to God]
saying, "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds
the Lord of Moses and Aaron

[Pharaoh] said, "How dare you believe in Him before I have given you permission? He [Moses] must be your leader who has taught you magic. But soon you will know. I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify all of you
They said, "We do not care! We will be returning to our Lord
We hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, because we were the first believers
We later revealed to Moses, "Travel by night with My worshipers, for you will be pursued
Then Pharaoh sent his marshals to the cities
[saying], "[The Children of Israel] are a small band
but they are offending us
and we are a vigilant society
So We expelled them from [their] gardens and springs
treasures and honored estates
Thus it was. [In time], We caused the Children of Israel to inherit all of this
So, they [the Egyptians] pursued them at sunrise
and when the two sides sighted one another, Moses' companions' said, "We will be overtaken
[Moses] said, "No! my Lord is with me; He will guide me
Then, We revealed to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea." It parted, and each part looked like a mountain
We brought the pursuers right into it
and We saved Moses and all who were with him
and We drowned the others
There is a sign in this, but most of them will not believe
Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all
Tell them the story of Abraham
when he asked his father and his people, "What do you worship
They said, "We worship idols, and we always attend to them
He asked, "Do they hear you when you call on them
Or do they benefit you, or harm you
They said, "But this is what we found our fathers doing
He said, "Have you really thought about what You have been worshipping
you and your forefathers
They are enemies to me. [I worship none] except the Lord of the worlds
Who created me. It is He Who guides me
and He who feeds me and gives me drink
and He who heals me when I am ill
and He who will cause me to die and then bring me back to life
and who, I hope, will forgive my sins on the Day of Judgment
[Abraham then said], "My Lord, grant me wisdom and allow me to join with the righteous
and grant me a lasting mention as one who told the truth among later generations
And make me among those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss
Forgive my father, for he has been of those who were misguided
and do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected
the Day when neither wealth nor children will benefit [anyone]
except the one who comes to God with a flawless heart
[On that day], Paradise will be brought near to those who were mindful of God
and Hell will be brought forth for those who were misled
It will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship
other than God? Can they help you or help themselves
So They will be hurled into Hell with those who misled them
with Iblis' helpers, all together
While bickering with each other they will say
By God, we were obviously misguided
when we equated you with the Lord of the worlds
No one misguided us except those who forced us to reject God's messages
So now we have no intercessors
nor a devoted friend
If we can only go back [to the world) , we will be believers
There is a sign in this, but most of them will not believe
Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all
The people of Noah denied the Messengers
when their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not be mindful of God
I am a trustworthy messenger to you
So be mindful of God and obey me
I ask no reward from you for doing this; my reward comes only from the Lord of the worlds
So be mindful of God, and obey me
They said, "How can we believe you when you are followed mostly by the lowest [class of People]
He said, "What do I know about what they have been doing
It is for my Lord alone to bring them to account, if you [could] only understand
I am not one to drive away the believers
I am only a clear warner
They said, "If you do not desist, Noah, you will surely be stoned
He said, "My Lord, my people have denied me
Judge between us decisively, and save me and those believers with me
So We saved him and those with him in the laden ark
and then We drowned the rest
There is a sign in this, but most of them will not believe
Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all
[The people of] Aad denied the Messengers
when their brother Hud said to them, "Will you not be mindful of God
I am a trustworthy messenger to you
so be mindful of God, and obey me
I ask no reward from you for doing this; my reward is only from the Lord of the worlds
Do you build a tower on every hill just to amuse yourselves
and construct for yourselves mighty castles hoping to live there eternally
And when you attack, why do you attack like tyrants
So be mindful of God, and obey me
and be mindful of Him Who provided you with everything you know
grazing livestock and children
gardens and springs
I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day
They said, "It is all the same to us whether you preach or not
this is only what our forefathers used to do
We will not be punished
They denied him, so We destroyed them. There is a sign in this, but most of them will not believe
Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all
[The people of] Thamud denied the Messengers
when their brother Salih said to them, "Will you not be mindful of God
I am a trustworthy messenger to you
so be mindful of God, and obey me
I ask no reward from you for doing this; my reward [comes) only from the Lord of the worlds
Do you think that you will be left secure in what you have here
[your] gardens and springs
fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit
And your fine homes that you skillfully carve out of the mountains
Be mindful of God and obey me
and do not obey those given to excess
who spread corruption on earth and do not set things right
They said, "You are bewitched
You are only a man like us, so bring a sign, if you are telling the truth
He said, "This is a camel. She will have a time to drink, and you will have a time, [each) on an appointed day
Do not harm her, unless you want to be seized by the punishment of a terrible day
But they hamstrung her and woke up fully regretful
and the punishment seized them. There is a sign in this, but most of them will not believe
Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all
The People of Lot denied the Messengers
When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not be mindful of God
I am a trustworthy messenger to you
So be mindful of God, and obey me
I ask no reward from you for doing this; my reward comes only from the Lord of the worlds
Why do you get intimate with men
and leave the mates your Lord has created for you? You people have transgressed all bounds
They said, "If you do not stop this, Lot, you will surely be kicked out
He said, "I despise your actions
My Lord, save me and my family from (the consequence of] what they do
So We saved him and his family, all of them
except for an old woman who stayed behind
Then, We destroyed the others
We poured upon them a rain of destruction. How terrible is such rain on those who had been forewarned
There is a sign in this, but most of them will not believe
Truly, your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all
The woods-dwellers denied the Messengers
When Shu'ayb said to them, "Will you not be mindful of God
I am a trustworthy messenger to you
so be mindful of God, and obey me
I ask no reward from you for doing this; my reward comes only from the Lord of the worlds
Give full measure, and do not cheat
Weigh with an even scale
and do not mislead people into thinking that their goods are worth less than their real value, and do not spread corruption on earth
Fear Him who created you and the former generations
They said, "You are surely bewitched
You are a man like us, and we think you are a liar
Make a fragment of the sky fall on us, if you are telling the truth
He said, "My Lord knows best what you are doing
But they did not believe him, and the punishment of the day of shadow seized them truly, the punishment of a terrible day
There is a sign in this, but most of them will not believe
Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all
This [Qur'an] is the revelation sent as you received it from the Lord of the worlds
and brought down by The Trustworthy Spirit
to your heart, that you may (Prophet] be of the warners
in a clear perfected [Arabic] tongue
It is mentioned in the scriptures of the ancients
Is it not a sign that the scholars of the Children of Israel knew it
Yet even if We had revealed it to a non-Arab
and he had recited it to them, they would still not believe in it
This is how We make it go unheeded through the hearts of those who force others to reject Our messages
they will not believe until they see the painful punishment
that will come upon them suddenly, when they do not expect it
They will say, "May we have more time
Why do they ask that we hasten Our punishment
Do you see that, if We gave them years of enjoyment
then inflicted the punishment as promised
what good would the years of enjoyment be to them
We have never destroyed a town without sending messengers to warn
and remind it, for We have never been unjust
The devils did not bring it [this Qur'an] down
They are not able, nor are they capable
As they are indeed barred from hearing [what goes on around the throne of His majesty]
So do not invoke another deity beside God, or you will incur punishment
Warn your closest relatives
and be humble and kind to the believers who follow you
but, if they disobey you, then say, "I am not responsible for what you are doing
And rely upon the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all
Who sees you when you arise
and when you move among those who prostrate themselves
He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing
Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend
They descend upon every sinful liar
who readily lends an ear, but most of them are liars
As for the poets, [only] the perverse follow them
Do you not see that they wander aimlessly in every valley
and say what they do not do
But except those [poets) who believe, do righteous deeds, remember God often, and defend themselves after they were wronged. Those who do wrong will soon know the kind of reversal they will receive
Ta, Seen. These are the verses of the Qur'an, a book that makes everything clear
a guidance and good news for the believers
who perform prayer and give the purifying alms, and are certain of the Hereafter
As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds seem right in their own eyes, so they will wander blindly
It is they who will receive the worst punishment, and, in the Hereafter, they are the most failing
You have received the Qur'an from the Grace of the All-Wise and All-Knowing
[Mention] when Moses said to his family, "I think I see a fire. I will bring you information or will bring you a burning torch that you may warm yourselves
But when he reached it, a voice called to him: "Blessed is He who is in the fire and whoever is around it. And may God be exalted in His Glory, the Lord of the Worlds
Moses, It is I-God, the Almighty, the Wise
Throw down your staff." But when he saw it moving as if it were a snake, he ran away and did not turn. [God said], "Moses, do not be afraid. In My presence the Messengers do not have anything to fear
I am Forgiving and Merciful to him who does wrong but [who then] replaces his bad deeds with good ones
And put your hand in your garment; it will come out white yet unharmed-one of nine signs [you will take] to Pharaoh and his people. They have been disobedient people
But when Our enlightening signs came to them, they said, "This is clearly magic
Even though they were convinced, they rejected them out of spite and pride. So consider what happen to those who spread corruption
We gave knowledge to David and Solomon, and they said, "Praise God, who has favored us over many of His believing servants
And Solomon was David's heir. He said, "People, we have been taught the language of birds, and we have been given a share of everything. This is clearly a blessing
Then one day, Solomon's troops of jinn and men and birds were assembled before him, and they were [marching] in rows
When they came upon the valley of the ants, one of the ants said, "Ants enter your dwellings so that you will not be crushed by Solomon and his soldiers without their knowing it

Solomon smiled, amused at what she said, and said, "My Lord, enable me to be grateful for the blessings You have given me and my parents, and that I may do righteous deeds accepted by You. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous worshipers
[One day] he inspected the birds and said, "Why do I not see the hoopoe, or is he absent without permission
I will surely punish him severely or kill him unless he brings me a convincing excuse
But the hoopoe did not stay away for long. It said, "I learned something that you do not know, and I have brought you news from Sheba
I found a woman ruling them. She has been given [an abundance] of all things, and she has a magnificent throne
I found that she and her people bow to the sun instead of God. Satan has made their deeds seem right to them and has turned them away from the right path, so they cannot find their way
Should they not bow to God, who brings forth what is hidden within the heavens and the earth, and who knows what you conceal and what you declare
He is God-there is no god except Him, Lord of the awesome Throne
[Solomon] said, "We will see whether you told the truth or were a liar
Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them. Then withdraw but see what response they will have
The Queen said, "Counselors, a gracious letter has been delivered to me
It is from Solomon, and it is, 'In the name of God, the Merciful-to-all, the Mercy Giver
Do not allow yourself to think that you are above me, come to me in submission
She said, "Council, advise me on the matter before me. I will not decide on a matter unless I hear from you
They said, "We are powerful and have great military might, but the decision is yours, and we stand ready to follow your orders
She said, "When kings enter a town, they ruin it and humiliate its proudest inhabitants. This is what they do
I am sending them a gift, and I will see what the messengers bring back

So when her messengers gained an audience with Solomon [and presented the gift], Solomon said, "Do you bring me wealth, when what God has given me is better than what He has given you? It is people like you who will rejoice in a gift like this
Go back [and tell] them, that we will come to them with soldiers whom they will be unable to face, and We will expel them from their land in humiliation, and disgrace
Then he said, "Council, which of you will bring me her magnificent throne before they come to me in submission
A daring one from among the jinn said, "I will bring it to you before you rise from your council. I am strong enough to do it and can be trusted

But one who had knowledge from the Book said, "I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you." And when [Solomon] saw it placed before him, he said, "This is a favor of my Lord to test me whether I will be grateful or not. And whoever is grateful, it is for his own good. As for the ungrateful, then my Lord is rich beyond need and generous
Then he said, "Disguise her throne; We will see whether she will allow herself to be guided [to truth] or will be among those who reject guidance
So when she arrived, she was asked, "Is your throne like this?" She said, "It is as if it were the same." [Solomon thought], "We were given knowledge before her, and we have been submissive to God
While what she worshiped beside God prevented her from believing, as she is from a people who deny the truth

She was told, "Enter the courtyard." But when she saw it, she thought it was a pool and uncovered her legs. He said, "It is a courtyard paved with smooth glass." She said, "My Lord, I have been wrong [because of my limited knowledge], and I submit with Solomon to God, Lord of the Worlds
And We sent to Thamud their brother Salih, [saying], "Worship God," but they were split into rival factions
He said, "My people, why are you so anxious to rush towards evil instead of to good? Why you do not ask God for forgiveness, so that maybe you will receive mercy
They said, "We consider you to be a bad omen, you and those with you." He said, "Your omen is with God. Rather, it is you who are being tested
And in the town there were heads of nine clans who spread mischief in the land and did no good

They said to each other, "Let's take an oath by God that we will kill him and his family tonight. Then we will say to his protector, 'we did not witness the destruction of his family, and we are truthful
So they devised their plan, and We too had a plan, but they were not aware of what We were planning
Look, then, at the outcome of their plan: We destroyed them and all their people
Here are their houses, desolate because they were unjust. There is a sign in that for people who know
And We saved those who believed and were mindful of God
And Lot, when he said to his people, "How can you commit this indecent act with your eyes wide open
You lust after men instead of women? You are ignorant people
